Key Arguments: The proposed legislation grants excessive powers to the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA) to force social media companies to remove content deemed false.
The fines for non-compliance are disproportionately large, potentially reaching billions of dollars, which is unprecedented in Australian legislation.
The legislation undermines the independence of ACMA, as the government can appoint, direct, and dismiss its members, leading to concerns about government overreach and control over information.
Notable Quotes: The bill proposes enormous powers be given to the Australian Communications and Media Authority to force social media companies such as Meta or Twitter to take down posts or tweets that ACMA, in its apparent all-knowing wisdom, decides is false and causes serious harm.
If there’s another piece of Australian legislation providing for fines of anything even close to that sum, I don’t know of it.
Please stop this dystopian bill. It has no place in a democratic country.
